extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

AT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced NSCLC with a KRAS-G12C mutation that has progressed after at least one systemic therapy
PICOs.Outcomes: response rate (measured by unspecified criteria), progression-free survival, adverse reactions (gastrointestinal including diarrhoea, dilation, nausea; hepatic including transaminase increase; renal including creatinine increase; QTc time prolongation)

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
PICOs.Outcomes: symptom control, preservation of quality of life, prolonged survival

EN.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: KRAS G12C mutation-positive locally advanced or metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer in adults whose disease has progressed on, or who cannot tolerate, platinum-based chemotherapy or anti-PD-1/PD-L1 immunotherapy
PICOs.Outcomes: overall survival, progression-free survival, health-related quality of life, objective response rate (measured by RECIST 1.1 criteria), adverse effects

PICOs.Population: KRAS G12C mutation-positive locally advanced or metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer in adults whose disease has progressed on, or who cannot tolerate, platinum-based chemotherapy or anti-PD-1/PD-L1 immunotherapy
PICOs.Outcomes: overall survival, progression-free survival, health-related quality of life, objective response rate (measured by RECIST 1.1 criteria), adverse effects

NL.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: patients with non–small-cell lung cancer stage IIIB/IV and an KRAS G12C mutation
PICOs.Outcomes: progression free survival, quality of life, overall survival, objective response rate, adverse events

PICOs.Outcomes: progression free survival, quality of life, overall survival, objective response rate, adverse events

PICOs.Population: metastatic NSCLC harboring a KRAS mutation, who received prior chemotherapy
PICOs.Outcomes: progression free survival, quality of life, overall survival, objective response rate, adverse events

IT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: metastatic, p. G12C mutant KRAS NSCLL patients progressing following prior platinum-based chemotherapies

FR.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: adult patients with advanced non-small cell adagrasib bronchial cancer (ASBC) with KRAS G12C mutation, whose disease has progressed after at least one prior systemic therapy
PICOs.Outcomes: potential risk of serious side effects on the skin

DE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: Patients with Stage IV NSCLC with a KRAS-G12C mutation who have experienced failure of at least one systemic therapy
PICOs.Outcomes: response rates, survival, adverse events, overall condition (Karnofsky or ECOG performance status)

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced NSCLC and KRAS G12C mutation previously treated with platinum-based chemotherapy and immunotherapy
PICOs.Outcomes: response rates (RECIST criteria), progression-free survival, adverse events (graded by CTCAE), duration of response

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced NSCLC and KRAS G12C mutation previously treated with platinum-based chemotherapy and immunotherapy
PICOs.Outcomes: response rates (RECIST criteria), progression-free survival, adverse events (graded by CTCAE), duration of response

PICOs.Population: patients with active KRAS G12C and 0-2 performance status and previously treated with platinum-based chemotherapy and immunotherapy (where applicable)
PICOs.Outcomes: response rates (RECIST criteria), progression-free survival, adverse events (graded by CTCAE), duration of response

PICOs.Outcomes: response rates (RECIST criteria), progression-free survival, adverse events (graded by CTCAE), duration of response

EU.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PICOs.Population: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
PICOs.Outcomes: mutation status determination, adequate coverage of mutations in exons 18-21 including resistance-associated mutations
